alert.note: Alert for Tehama (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 15 at 3:50AM PDT until March 15 at 11:49PM PDT by NWS Sacramento
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in California... Sacramento River Above Bend Bridge affecting Tehama County. Sacramento River Below Red Bluff Diversion Dam affecting Tehama County. Sacramento River At Vina Woodson Bridge affecting Tehama County. Sacramento River At Tehama Bridge affecting Tehama County. Sacramento River Near Hamilton City affecting Glenn and Butte Counties. Sacramento River At Ord Ferry affecting Glenn and Butte Counties. For the Upper Sacramento River...including Bend Bridge, Red Bluff Diversion Dam, Tehama Bridge, Vina Woodson Bridge, Hamilton City, Ord Ferry, Butte City, Moulton Weir, Colusa Weir, Colusa Bridge, Tisdale Weir...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. This approaches the flood of record. * WHERE...Sacramento River below Red Bluff Diversion Dam. * WHEN...Until late this evening. * IMPACTS...At 259.6 feet, Extensive flooding problems begin to happen in low lying areas of Red Bluff. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:30 AM PDT Wednesday the stage was 258.2 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 2:30 AM PDT Wednesday was 258.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 258.8 feet early this morning. It will then fall below flood stage late this morning. - Flood stage is 255.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 260.0 feet on 01/02/1997. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. For more hydrologic information and stage definitions refer to the following web site: wrh.noaa.gov/sto/hydro_data.php The next statement will be issued this evening at 615 PM PDT.
